{{also|Arbeiten}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|arbeiten}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*arbaidijaną}}, ultimately from {{der|de|ine-pro|*h₃órbʰos|t=orphan}}, from which English {{m|en|orphan}} is also derived. Cognates include {{cog|nl|arbeiden}}, {{cog|osx|arvedian}}, {{cog|got|𐌰𐍂𐌱𐌰𐌹𐌳𐌾𐌰𐌽}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈaʁbaɪ̯tən/|[ˈʔäʁbäɪ̯tən]|[-tn̩]|[-ʔn̩]}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-arbeiten.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-arbeiten.ogg}} * {{hyphenation|de|ar|bei|ten}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|arbeitet|arbeitete|gearbeitet}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[work]] {{gloss|to do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers}} #* '''1932''', [[w:de:Erich Mühsam|Erich Mühsam]], ''[[s:de:Die Befreiung der Gesellschaft vom Staat|Die Befreiung der Gesellschaft vom Staat]]'', in: Erich Mühsam: Prosaschriften II, Verlag europäische ideen Berlin (1978), page 255: #*: Wir verstehen unter Kommunismus die auf Gütergemeinschaft beruhende Gesellschaftsbeziehung, die jedem nach seinen Fähigkeiten zu '''arbeiten''', jedem nach seinen Bedürfnissen zu verbrauchen erlaubt. #*:: We understand by communism the relationship of society that is based on public ownership, that allows everyone to '''work''' according to his capabilities, everyone to consume according to his needs. # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[work]], [[function]], [[run]], [[operate]] {{gloss|to be operative, in action}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[ferment]] {{gloss|to react, using fermentation}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[work]], [[execute]] {{gloss|to set into action}} # {{lb|de|transitive|briefly|_|artisanal}} to [[make]], [[produce]] {{gloss|to create}} #: {{ux|de|Die Kommode ist aus Eichenholz '''gearbeitet'''.|The drawer is '''made''' of oak-wood.}} # {{lb|de|transitive|only with pronouns like ''[[etwas]]'', ''[[nichts]]''}} to [[do]], [[perform]] {{gloss|to carry out or execute, especially something involving work}} #: {{ux|de|Was '''arbeitest''' du?|What '''are''' you '''doing'''?|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Ich '''arbeite''' nichts.|I'm '''doing''' nothing.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[work]] oneself (to) {{gloss|to make oneself (a certain state) by working}} #: {{ux|de|'''sich''' zu Tode '''arbeiten'''|'''to work oneself''' to death|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|'''sich''' erschöpft '''arbeiten'''|'''to work oneself''' to the point of exhaustion|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[work]] one's [[way]] {{gloss|to attain through work, by gradual degrees}} # {{lb|de|reflexive|and|impersonal}} to [[work]] (''translated by rephrasing to use a general'' “[[you]]” ''or with the gerund,'' “[[working]]”) {{gloss|to do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-auto||arbei|ten}} * The past participle can also be {{l|de|gearbeit}} and rather rarely {{l|de|gearbeitt}}, {{l|de|gearbeit't}}. ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|abarbeiten}} * {{l|de|Arbeit}} * {{l|de|Arbeiten}} * {{l|de|arbeitend}} * {{l|de|Arbeiter}} * {{l|de|aufarbeiten}} * {{l|de|ausarbeiten}} * {{l|de|bearbeiten}} * {{l|de|durcharbeiten}} * {{l|de|einarbeiten}} * {{l|de|emporarbeiten}} * {{l|de|erarbeiten}} * {{l|de|handarbeiten}} * {{l|de|heranarbeiten}} * {{l|de|herausarbeiten}} * {{l|de|hinarbeiten}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|hocharbeiten}} * {{l|de|kurzarbeiten}} * {{l|de|mitarbeiten}} * {{l|de|nacharbeiten}} * {{l|de|schwarzarbeiten}} * {{l|de|totarbeiten}} * {{l|de|überarbeiten}} * {{l|de|umarbeiten}} * {{l|de|verarbeiten}} * {{l|de|vorarbeiten}} * {{l|de|wegarbeiten}} * {{l|de|zuarbeiten}} * {{l|de|zusammenarbeiten}} {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
